drawnet.lib.ddl
Class Formalism

java.lang.Object
  drawnet.lib.ddl.Formalism
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Formalism
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Manages a Formalism structure.

Constructor Detail

Formalism

public Formalism(java.lang.String mainId)
Creates a new formalism. It creates the "_root" element and adds the main element.

Parameters:
mainId - the name of the main element of the newly created formalism

Formalism

public Formalism()
Creates a new formalism. It creates the "_root" element but doesn't add the main element.

getSubElementByPath

public ElementType getSubElementByPath(ElementType startPoint,
                                       java.lang.String path,
                                       boolean inParents)
Gets a sub-element given its path.

Parameters:
startPoint - the ElementType to start from
path - path of the element (startPoint out)
inParents - set to true if a search in parents is needed (often useful in case of inheritance)
Returns:
the element or null if not existing, sets error accordingly

getSubElementByPath

public ElementType getSubElementByPath(java.lang.String path,
                                       boolean inParents)
Gets a sub-element given its path. The search starts from the root element.

Parameters:
path - path of the element (startPoint out)
inParents - set to true if a search in parents is needed (often useful in case of inheritance)
Returns:
the element or null if not existing, sets error accordingly

addDefaultPlane

public boolean addDefaultPlane(java.lang.String planeId)
Adds a plane to the default plane set.
All sub-elements that don't belong to any plane will belong to this set of planes.

Parameters:
planeId - id of the plane to add to the default planes set
Returns:
true if added, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

removeDefaultPlane

Parameters:

Returns:
true if removed, false otherwise, sets error accordingly
Since:
2007.11.12

addPlane

public boolean addPlane(java.lang.String id,
                        int planeOpt)
Adds a plane.

Parameters:
id - the name of the new Plane
planeOpt - constant of the class PlaneType representing a plane option:
  • OPT_QM Optional unique plane
  • OPT_ONE Required unique plane
  • OPT_STAR Optional multiple plane
  • OPT_PLUS Required multiple plane
Returns:
true if ok, false otherwise, sets error accordingly

includedFormalismNames

public java.lang.String[] includedFormalismNames()
Returns an array of included formalism names.
The array is sorted by order of inclusion.

Returns:
the array of strings

addIncludedFormalismName

public void addIncludedFormalismName(java.lang.String incFilename)
Adds an included formalism filename to the include list of the current formalism (for writing purposes).
Warning: only the formalism filename is added, the formalism structure will not be put in the root element of the current formalism. For this to happen you should use includeFormalism().

Parameters:
incFilename - the filename to add
See Also:
includeFormalism(Formalism, String)

removeIncludedFormalismName

public boolean removeIncludedFormalismName(java.lang.String incFilename)
Removes an included formalism filename from the include list of the current formalism (for writing purposes).
Warning: only the formalism filename is removed, the formalism structure is still in the root element of the current formalism.

Parameters:
incFilename - the filename to add
Returns:
true on success, false otherwise, set error accordingly

removeIncludedFormalismName

public boolean removeIncludedFormalismName(int index)
Removes an included formalism filename from the include list of the current formalism (for writing purposes).
Warning: only the formalism filename is removed, the formalism structure is still in the root element of the current formalism.

Parameters:
index - the order index of the formalism filename to remove
Returns:
true on success, false otherwise, set error accordingly

includeFormalism

public void includeFormalism(Formalism f,
                             java.lang.String incFilename)
Includes a formalism in this formalism. It allows inheritance.

Parameters:
f - the formalism to include

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
Clones a formalism. It makes a deep-clone, copying also sub-elements and properties.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a perfect copy of the formalism
Throws:
java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

setFormalismFilename

public void setFormalismFilename(java.lang.String ffn)
Sets the name of the file containing the formalism definition.

Parameters:
ffn - the name of the file.

getFormalismFilename

public java.lang.String getFormalismFilename()
Gets the name of the file containing the formalism definition.

Returns:
the name of the file.

append

public void append(Formalism fAppend)
Appends a formalism to the current one. Appends all root sub-elements of the given formalism to the current formalism root. Every sub-element is treated as a formalism and it is not merged with the current one.

Parameters:
fAppend - formalism to append to the current one

merge

public void merge(Formalism fMerge)
Merges the given formalism with the current one.

It merges:

  • included formalisms
  • planes
  • default planes
  • phases

If the given formalism was included in the current one, it is removed from the included formalisms list.

Parameters:
fMerge - the formalism to merge with this one
Since:
2007.11.21

split

public Formalism split(ElementType etSplit)
Extracts the given ElementType (must be from the current formalism) and puts it in a brand new one as main element. The new formalism has:
  • included formalisms
  • planes
  • default planes
  • phases
in common with the current one. Moreover, the resulting formalism includes the current formalism, too.

Parameters:
etSplit - the splitting element
Returns:
a new formalism
Since:
2007.12.17
